Economics (Macro & Micro Concepts).question: Which of the following with regard to the term 'bank run' is correct?
options: The net balance of money a bank has in its chest at the end of the day's business
The ratio of bank's total deposits and total liabilities
A panic situation when the deposit holders start withdrawing cash from the banks
The period in which a bank creates highest credit in the market
Economics (Macro & Micro Concepts).answer: A panic situation when the deposit holders start withdrawing cash from the banks
Economics (Macro & Micro Concepts).explanation: A bank run occurs when a large number of customers of a bank or another financial institution withdraw their deposits simultaneously due to concerns about the bank's solvency. The panic situation arises when depositors withdraw their part fearing that the bank will be unable to repay their deposits in full and on time,

Economics (Macro & Micro Concepts).question:
Which of the following will be the outcome if an economy is under the inflationary pressure?
1. Domestic currency heads for depreciation.
2. Exports become less competitive with imports getting costlier.
3. Cost of borrowing decreases.
4. Bondholders get benefitted.
Select the correct answer using the code given below.
Economics (Macro & Micro Concepts).explanation: If an economy is under inflationary pressure the most likely effects include the depreciation of domestic currencies and the cost of borrowing also decreases.

Economics (Macro & Micro Concepts).explanation: Full employment is the employment level at which every individual who desires to work at the existing wage rate gets employed. If the condition of unemployment occurs, it is a temporary/abnormal condition in the economy.

Economics (Macro & Micro Concepts).question: In India, the term 'hot money' is used to refer to
Economics (Macro & Micro Concepts).explanation: Hot money is cash that investors from foreign countries will invest during the short term in search of the highest interest rate possible. With the opening up of debt and equity markets to foreign portfolio investors, the FPI (Foreign Portfolio Investment) has emerged as the leading form of quick money flows globally.

Economics (Indian Economy).question: Which one of the following statements is not correct?
options: Creation of National Investment and Infrastructure Fund (NIIF) was announced in the Union Budget, 2015-16.
NIIF is a fund for enhancing infrastructure facility in the country.
NIIF and NIF (National Investment Fund) are the names of the same organization,
NIIF can have more than one alternative investment fund,
Economics (Indian Economy).answer: NIIF and NIF (National Investment Fund) are the names of the same organization,
Economics (Indian Economy).explanation:
The purpose of the National Investment Fund (NIF) is related to disinvestment proceedings of central public sector enterprises and to invest the same to generate earnings without depleting the corpus.
National Investment and Infrastructure Fund (NIIF) is a fund created by the Government of India for enhancing infrastructure financing in the country.

Economics (Indian Economy).question: Which one of the following statements is correct with respect to the composition of national income in India?
options: The share of manufacturing sector has declined.
The share of services sector has increased sharply.
The share of agriculture has remained static.
The share of services sector has declined.
Economics (Indian Economy).answer: The share of services sector has increased sharply.
Economics (Indian Economy).explanation: The contribution of Services Sector of India to overall GDP has increased sharply, from 41% in 1990-91 to 66% in 2014-15.
